intro: Meconopsis lancifolia subsp. daliensis, commonly known as the Dali meconopsis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental qualities and is also of interest in botanical research due to its unique adaptations to its alpine habitat.
